titleStmt.title: A. Dupuy to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG11974

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 80, Folder 862-64 HENRY COUNTY History 51st Rgt. Ky. Militia

body.p:
P. 205
Eminence Ky Nv 29th 1864.
Gov Bramlette
Dear Sir
We are over run with Guerillas can you send some soldeirs Sixty would do, if they are mounted, they are scattered over the country, a young man just from New Castle reports thirty there at this Time.
I think from what I am told there are two or three wonded wounded rebels in the county, one wounded by the state troops one day last week.

Eminence Ky
Nov 29th 1864
Dupuy A.
To The Gov-
Wants some soldiers sent here. sixty would be sufficient if mounted. Thinks there are two or three wounded rebels in the county.

L. B. No 8. 1864 P. 205
Recd A. G. O. Nov 30th 1864.
